.  It was one of the waypoints along the original route of historic
Bernalillo is just off Interstate Highway 25, although travelers following the

will get there via back roads.  The nearest major airport is in Albuquerque.

A commuter railroad, the

value: http://www.nmrailrunner.com New Mexico Rail Runner Express

, and some of the other small communities along the Rio Grande. There are two stations in Bernalillo: One is on US-550 right near the I-25 exit, which is mainly just a park and ride lot. The second station is right in the center of town, in the old historic area. The train runs with limited service daily.

Driving is the most reliable way to move through this town, and just about the only way to get to places on the west side of the Rio Grande, like Coronado State Monument. US-550 is the main drag through town.

Public transportation to points within Bernalillo is largely non-existent. A dedicated shuttle connects the Rail Runner station to the Santa Ana Star Casino, but that's it.

There are a few walkable areas of town, like the old main street of Bernalillo (Camino del Pueblo) with its shops, restaurants, and historic structures. This area of town is also within easy walking distance of the Downtown Bernalillo Rail Runner station.

value: address=located on the west side of the Rio Grande, north of US-550
price=$3 adults, free for children 16 & under

content=In 1540, Francisco Vásquez de Coronado, a Spanish explorer, passed through the valley, where he is said to have spent time at an Indian village here. Today, the monument preserves the ruins of that village, Kuaua Pueblo. You can climb down into a reconstructed kiva and see Spanish colonial artifacts on exhibit at the museum. There's also a lovely little picnic area on the bank of the Rio Grande.
price=$6 adults, $5 seniors, $3 children, children under 6 free
content=A large collection of vintage automobiles, with some of them even for sale.
Downtown Bernalillo has a number of historic buildings on the National Register of Historic Places.

takes place in Bernalillo every Labor Day weekend. Wineries from around the state set up booths and give you a chance to taste and purchase their wines. The festival takes place at 243 Camino Del Pueblo, just south of US-550 and within walking distance of the Sandoval County/US-550 Rail Runner station. Tickets are $10 and include a wine glass.
If you're in to gambling, the nearby Santa Ana Pueblo operates the
, which is on US-550 across the Rio Grande from Bernalillo. The pueblo also operates the
, which is behind the casino next to the Prairie Star Restaurant.

hours=Su-Th 7:30AM-9PM, F-Sa 7:30AM-9:30PM (open a half hour later in summer)
content=Good Mexican and American fare, large portions. Located in an old adobe building with a Western-themed atmosphere inside. There's a lounge with bar and live music.
content=Great, inexpensive New Mexican food. Green sauce is world class, red sauce not far behind. Heavenly sopapillas. Another must-stop for the Route 66 foodie road warrior.
directions=west of town off Tamaya Blvd

content=Eclectic menu with American, New Mexican, and Asian components. It has an extensive wine cellar, excellent outdoor patio with views of the Sandias and an inventive menu which changes frequently but is always outstanding. Patio dining available. Can be a bit pretentious, but will meet the standards of any foodie.

content=Antique saloon that is said to have the oldest liquor license in New Mexico and has been used as a setting for a number of Western films. Lots of memorabilia and old photographs on the walls from generations of bar patrons.

Bernalillo has a few chain motels located along US-550, including a
. Lodging may be hard to find in October when the Albuquerque International Balloon Fiesta occurs.

content=The inn and grounds are beautiful, with conference and meeting facilities available, near the Rio Grande with a spectacular view of the Sandia Mountains to the east. There's lot of activities at the hotel with a focus on Native American culture. The Twin Warriors golf course is located adjacent to the hotel.
, one of the biggest tourist destinations in the American Southwest, is about 45 miles north on I-25.
